translations.translation: It is a cause of great distress to those who are kafir.
It is surely the nemesis of unbelievers.
and surely it will be a cause of regret for the unbelievers.
and (on the Day of Judgment) this will be a great source of regret for the unbelievers.
And indeed it is a despair for the disbelievers.
And indeed it will be an anguish for the disbelievers.
And most surely it is a great grief to the unbelievers.
Surely it is a sorrow to the unbelievers;
And lo! it is indeed an anguish for the disbelievers.
it will be a source of bitter regret for those who deny the truth --
And verily it shall be an occasion of anguish Unto the infidels.
And indeed it will be a [matter of] regret for the faithless.
But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.
And indeed it (this Quran) will be an anguish for the disbelievers (on the Day of Resurrection).
Indeed, it is a sorrow to the unbelievers
And it is surely a source of grief for the unbelievers.
And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
[69:50] And assuredly it, that is, the Qur’ān, is a [cause of] anguish for the disbelievers, when they see the reward of those who affirmed its truth and the punishment of those who denied it.
(And lo! It) i.e. the Qur'an (is indeed an anguish) a remorse (for the disbelievers) on the Day of Judgement.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَإِنَّهُ } أي: القرآن { لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلْكَافِرِينَ } [الحاقة: 50] في الدنيا والآخرة، يتحسرون في الدنيا من نزوله على المؤمنين وإن كانوا لا يظهرون، ويتحسرون أيضاً في الآخرة بترتب الثواب على من صدقه وآمن به، وهم حينئذٍ يتحسرون ويتندمون على عدم الإيمان والتصديق به
